item.title: Brief introduction to my current interests
item.description: My current research interest is app development with Xcode, Swift & SwiftUI. SwiftUI is Swifts graphical counter part, and is responsible for the graphics behind an iOS or MacOS app. It caught my attention as I like the idea of being able to create solutions for issues or inconveniences in mine, and others day to day life with their smartphones and computers. I also love how Xcode incorporates an emulator to preview each line of code as you right it in real time.

item.title: Java
item.description: I have been working with the Java language since Highschool on and off. It is one of my favorite languages to work with and one of the most popular out there.

item.title: Python
item.description: Python is my favorite language I have learned, and the one I am most comfortable working with! I love its simple and elegant design. It is easy to pick up and quick to write. I have been working with python for the past 3 years now.

item.title: SQL
item.description: I am not as experienced in SQL as I am Python or Java, however I have taken a course that revolved around queries and SQLITE databases and was very interested in the language.

item.title: Swift (In Progress)
item.description: Swift is the next language that I am currently learning. It’s use for creating iOS apps and software sparked my interest. I have begun learning this language however it is marked as in progress as I am not at a proficient level with the language yet.

item.title: Tic-Tac-Toe made with PySimpleGUI
item.description: About the project You can find the current release on Tic-Tac-Toe! This was a final project for my software engineering class, and was quite a challenging one. It was my first time implementing graphics into a Python program. This was done using PySimpleGUI which was a challenge in it self to learn, however well worth it. Over all the project was fun to complete, and gave the user a nice looking way to play tic-tac-toe against friends or an AI.
